climbs.name: InSpired
climbs.fa: Caleb Mazurkiewicz, Dalton MacNeil, Melanie Cormier and Lydia Stewart

content.description:
Start up a short juggy face past a bolt to a low ledge. Climb the corner and follow the weakness past a couple more ledges. Follow the bolts through the surprisingly steep dihedral/crack system up the arrete to the top. Unique climbing in a beautiful setting.



Follow the trail to the wave wall down the bear cave gully. Continue past the pillar routes and Just before turning (skiers right) when the trail levels outs towards the wave wall you will see a cliff on your (skiers left) about 60meters away. The climb is found on this cliff and goes up and obvious Spire looking feature.

Sport rack. Rap anchor

From Pillar of Hope, continue down the wall, past a gully, which has a large cave in the wall on the left side of that gully. Pillar of Dope starts in a corner 6 meters left of the cave in a corner with a gorgeous hand crack. The hand crack narrows to thin hands, then off-fingers. Past the off-fingers, traverse right, then up into the chimney between the pillar and the wall. Continue up the chimney to a set of rings.

From Pillar of Hope, continue down the wall, past a gully, which has a large cave in the wall on the left side of that gully. Pillar of Dope starts in a corner 6 meters left of the cave in a corner with a gorgeous hand crack.
Standard rack. Ring at top.

Pitch 1 – 5.8, PG. 19m. A wide crack, 10 meters downhill from the detached pillar at the start of the wall, leads into cracks of various sizes, then up the steep off-width before traversing right to gain a belay ledge.
Pitch 2 – 5.9, G. 13m. Follow the overhanging hand crack until it is possible to move right to a ledge and gain a thin-hands crack which takes you the summit of the pillar. Rings on top allow you to reach the ground with one 60m rope.

A wide crack, 10 meters downhill from the detached pillar at the start of the wall.
Standard rack. Rings for anchors.

Part of the same geological formation which makes up Wave Wall, though quite isolated from that area by forest, gullies, and ledges. This area has couple walls (both sides of the gully) and boasts several pinnacles with inspiring summits.
